DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to represent the final status of the patient related to the adverse event..

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Result or outcome of an adverse event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to support CTMS v.3.02 (and subsequent versions) reporting requirements.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or event that is attributed the adverse event._The words of something written._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

Concepts.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has not improved or recuperated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.

Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

Concepts.longName: Recovered from Adverse Event with Sequelae
Concepts.definition: One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome where the subject recuperated but retained pathological conditions resulting from the prior disease or injury.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A condition or event that is attributed to the adverse event and is the result or conclusion of the adverse event.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Some PVs in the CDE have a workaround with :Concept Number:Source (when applicable) to capture the correct term type and definition from NCIt.

DataElement.changeDescription: Released during draft new, retired and orphan content clean-up_11.27.18_ghd; Curated to support UNMC clinical trial
